docs.snippet: When his signs supporting Donald J. Trump for president were stolen or vandalized at his home in Queens, Michael Ricatto tried to catch the perpetrator. What happened next was a surprise....
docs.lead_paragraph: When his signs supporting Donald J. Trump for president were stolen or vandalized at his home in Queens, Michael Ricatto tried to catch the perpetrator. What happened next was a surprise.
docs.abstract: Kew Gardens, Queens, resident Michael Ricatto is fined by Parks Dept for posting fliers offering reward for information about thief who stole pro-Trump signs from his yard; signs had been stapled to trees, which could damage and potentially kill them; Ricatto says fines are motivated by political favoritism.

headline.main: Trump Signs, Trees and Accusations That a New York Agency Is Biased
headline.print_headline: Quest to Find a Trump-Sign Thief Leads to Fines and Suspicions of Bias

docs.snippet: Green Party presidential candidate Jill Stein said on Thursday she has raised $3.5 million to force recounts of the Nov. 8 election results in Wisconsin, Michigan and Pennsylvania, three states where Donald Trump scored narrow wins....
docs.lead_paragraph: Green Party presidential candidate Jill Stein said on Thursday she has raised $3.5 million to force recounts of the Nov. 8 election results in Wisconsin, Michigan and Pennsylvania, three states where Donald Trump scored narrow wins.

headline.main: Green Party Raises $3.5 Million for Presidential Vote Recounts

docs.snippet: A group of election lawyers and data experts has asked Hillary Clinton's campaign to call for a recount of the vote totals in three battleground states — Wisconsin, Michigan and Pennsylvania — to ensure that a cyberattack was not commi...
docs.lead_paragraph: A group of election lawyers and data experts has asked Hillary Clinton's campaign to call for a recount of the vote totals in three battleground states — Wisconsin, Michigan and Pennsylvania — to ensure that a cyberattack was not committed to manipulate the totals.
